name: Corn and Pea Samosas in Caraway Seed Pastry
author: Joanna
summary: A samosa presser is available from Asian grocery stores, but I use a dumpling press and it works just as well. I love these tasty treats and they are always gobbled up quickly.
ingredients: ½ cup corn, drained and rinsed
½ cup frozen peas, or to taste
directions: Mix and gradually stir in enough water to form a firm dough
Knead on a floured surface until smooth
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate dough for 30 minutes
Heat ghee in a pan over medium heat
Add onion, garlic, ginger, garam masala, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and chile powder
Cook and stir until onion is soft, about 5 minutes
Add corn, peas, and coconut milk
Remove filling from heat and cool to room temperature
Roll dough on a floured surface to 1/16-inch thickness
Cut into 3 3/4-inch rounds and place a rounded teaspoon of filling into the center of each round
Brush edges with water and press together using your finger or a samosa presser
Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Deep-fry samosas until browned, about 5 minutes per batch
